column4: Hi i am wondering why libvorbis0a has an a on the end of its name? This is a problem for me as i am unable to install a .deb which has the dependency of libvorbis0. Please can someone help?
the ABI got changed and therefore the soname had to change. Get whoever provided the .deb to rebuild it against a vaguely current system.
(or rebuild it yourself, assuming you have source)
coming from a rpm distro is it possible to remove libvorbis0a with a nodeps flag?
nodeps is EVIL AND BAD AND WRONG
(no, it will break things)
rpm's casual tolerance of nodeps is one of its worst features. you can do it with dpkg, but apt will complain.
and in this case it probably won't work either
s/either/anyway/
but if i then install libvorbis0 it wouldnt break things, would it?
the libvorbis0a transition is one that you just have to swallow. really, get the maintainer of the package in question to rebuild it, it's the easiest way
ok thank you
if it were possible to install libvorbis0 then you would be able to do so without needing to force dependency breakage along the way
it is possible its just that i have libvorbis0a installed at the moment
libvorbis0 died ages ago; no Debian-descended distribution since Debian 3.0 has it
where's this package, anyway?
i want to install libavcodec which requires it
the version of libavcodec2 in Ubuntu multiverse depends on libvorbis0a
I'm pretty sure there are other builds out there for Debian sarge which depend on libvorbis0a too
is that in the hoary repo?
either warty or hoary
arrr i see it thank you
